728454f-b.text:
Arthur Kill Road (right, telephoae poles thereon), north of Sharrotts Road. Shown, in a northeasterly direction from the clay pit on the west side of Arthur Kill Road, are the Charleston Reformed Church (left), Public School No. 4 (tall building) and
the old Storer house on the extreme right.
May 6, 1930
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view in the same direction, across the clay pit
near Sharrotts Road.
May 6, 1930
P. L. Sperr
728454f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Sharrotts Road, Staten Island, NY
728454f-b.original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Sharrotts Road

728455f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road (right, telerhone poles thereon), north of Sharrotts Road. The view is in a northeasterly direction across a clay pit on the west side of Arthur Kill Road and shows the Socony oil tanks lining the Arthur Fill shore. That area is known as Soconyport. AAso shown is the Charleston Reformed Church (center) and
Public School No. 4 (right).
May 12, 1937
L. Sperr
(2)
Viewing in a northwesterly direction toward Soconyport across
the clay pit.
May 12, 1937
P. L. Sperr
728455f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Sharrotts Road, Staten Island, NY
728455f-a.original_title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Sharrotts Road
